result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas M Brosinger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Theft-Movable Property fr. Person/Corpse, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Programs.
Consecutive to: Milwaukee County Case #13CF724.

Court will allow transfer to any other county.
Consecutive to: Milwaukee County Case #13CF724.

miscConds.notes:
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Defendant already gave a DNA Sample.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances, or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with victim or the BP Gas Station listed in the Criminal Complaint.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on the any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Thomas M Brosinger in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail - OTP'd From Fox Lake Correctional), with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   

Defendant pleads No Contest to count 1.
Court finds th defendant Guilty of count 1.
Repeater enhancer is struck.
Defendant presented statements to the court.


Court orders the following:
Total Prison: 4.5 Years
Initial Confinement: 2 Years
Extended Supervision: 2.5 Years
Consecutive to:  Milwaukee County Case 13CF724
Stayed

If Revoked:
Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


Term of Probation:  3 Years
Consecutive to:  Milwaukee County Case 13CF724
Court will allow transferred to any other county.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim or the BP Gas Station listed in the criminal complaint
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

Costs:  $268
DNA Surcharge:  $250 (Sample has already been provided).
DRGOD Surcharge: $10
To be paid as a Condition of Probation

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
